sources.title: Home Town Story
sources.description: Blake Washburn (Jeffrey Lynn) blames manufacturer MacFarland (Donald Crisp) for his defeat in the race for re-election to the state legislature. He takes over his uncle's newspaper to take on big business as an enemy of the people. Miss Martin (Marilyn Monroe) works in the "Herald" newspaper office. When tragedy strikes, Blake must re-examine his views.

sources.title: Home Town Story
sources.description: Title: Home Town Story Summary: After failing to be re-elected, politician Blake Washburn returns home and becomes editor of the local newspaper. When he notices the influence the paper has on the public, he uses it to appeal to potential voters in the next election. Directed by: Arthur Pierson Actors: Jeffrey Lynn, Donald Crisp, Marjorie Reynolds Production Company: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer (MGM) Release Date: 18 May 1951 (USA) Aspect Ratio: 1.37 : 1 Blake Washburn blames manufacturer MacFarland for his defeat in the race for re-election to the state legislature. He takes over his uncle's newspaper to take on big business as an enemy of the people. Miss Martin works in the "Herald" newspaper office. When tragedy strikes, Blake must re-examine his views.

sources.title: Home Town Story (1951) MARILYN MONROE
sources.description:
Stars: Marilyn Monroe, Jeffrey Lynn, Donald Crisp
Writer/Director: Arthur Pierson

Iconic blonde bombshell Marilyn Monroe plays the secretary
to a small-town newspaper editor who begins a campaign to
prove that corrupt big business has taken over City Hall!

metadata.Plot: Blake Washburn blames manufacturer MacFarland for his defeat in the race for re-election to the state legislature. He takes over his uncle's newspaper to take on big business as an enemy of the people. Miss Martin works in the "Herald" newspaper office. When tragedy strikes, Blake must re-examine his views.
